# SweatTent Outdoor Sauna

##  SweatTent Outdoor Sauna

The ultimate outdoor sauna tent for your backyard and beyond. Our wood burning
sauna tent heats up to 200 degrees in 30 minutes! Price includes:

  * Insulated pop up sauna tent
  * Stainless steel sauna stove
  * 20 lbs of sauna rocks  

  * Sauna rock basket
  * Wood thermometer
  * Ergonomic fire poker  

  * Weatherproof roof cover
  * Heat resistant gloves
  * Instruction manual

## Pre-Order Now For March 15th Shipping.

Pre-Order Now

FREE IN-HOME DELIVERY BY DEC 25TH

## What’s Included

Portable sauna tent

Insulated, water resistant & portable. Our special "QuickPop" design allows
you to set up alone or with a partner. Comes with carry bag. Weighs 30 lbs.

Stainless steel stove

Our specially designed stainless steel sauna stove produces the highest heat
output possible (200°F) in the shortest amount of time (30 minutes). Comes
with carry bag. Weighs 50 lbs.

Sauna rocks & holder

Pour water over the sauna rocks to create hot steam and turn your SweatTent
into a steam sauna.

Weatherproof cover

Fiberglass roof cover ensures your Sweat Tent portable sauna is protected from
the elements.

Fire poker & gloves

For safe handling of the portable sauna stove and stoking the fire.

Thermometer

Our handcrafted wooden thermometer displays both temperature and humidity.

Instruction manual

A physical, easy to understand instruction manual is included with every
purchase.

1 year warranty

Every SweatTent portable sauna comes with a 1 year limited lifetime warranty
that covers the tent and the stove.

RatingLeast Helpful

  *  **Jack W.**

Verified Reviewer

I recommend this product

SweatTent helped you to...  Sleep better, Reduce stress levels, Detoxify,
Improve circulation

Where do you use your SweatTent?  My backyard

Rated 5 out of 5 stars

10 months ago

Sweat tent trial runs

During the first week of having the Sweat Tent I used it 6 times. It has done
everything I expected it to. The space inside could fit 3-4 people if needed.
Any more than that and you’re likely getting too close to the burning hot
stove. I feel like 2-3 is the right number though for a good sauna session. I
use it on my deck, I placed some rubber mats underneath to help regulate how
much air flow can come from below with a piece of treated plywood underneath
the actual stove. I have gotten it to 200°+ but found that I prefer it right
around 170-180° with about 50-60 on the hygrometer. Best to get the fire going
with kindling then continue to stoke with medium sized split hard firewood for
a long even burn. Quality of the tent is great so far, I’ve used it in a
blizzard. with plenty of snow on the roof. Be prepared for some of the seams
to leak as the heat melts snow off the roof. I didn’t mind this as it added
humidity. The first few sessions I kept all window coverings on because I
questioned the ability for the plastic windows to hold heat well, I later
noticed that if you have a good burning fire you’re probably fine to take the
covers off as it holds heat quite well. Keep in mind I‘ve only used it in
below freezing temps as I’m in the middle of Minnesota winter. All in all, so
far so good and happy with my purchase/investment.

Where do you use your SweatTent?  My backyard

Rated 5 out of 5 stars

10 months ago

Best sauna all around A+!!

Probably the best purchase ive made yet!

Everything is as advertised and beyond!! The initial setup is simple and
QUICK! Once you season your stove (outside not inside the sweat tent) for a
hour. You’re officially ready to sweat! And it doesn’t disappoint.. 200f in 30
minutes. If you’re going to leave your sweat tent outside over a snow fall i
would recommend putting an 80 inch pole in the middle of the sweat tent where
the roof is where the supporting joint is that pops down so it doesn’t
collapse due to the weight. Otherwise you can just take it down and set it up
every time. This is by no means a bad thing just preference for those who want
to leave their sweat tent up. If you’re worried about the tent fading due to
sun exposure.. you can always put a tarp over it and remove the top portion of
the pipes the pop out the roof. Just my two cents! Killer product!! I highly
recommend it for anyone who wants to get all the benefits of saunas!!

## Frequently Asked Questions

Does it get hot & stay hot in colder climates?

Yes! Our tents are constructed with two layers of durable fabric with one
layer of insulation in-between that retains heat very well, even in colder
climates. When used properly, Sweat Tent will maintain temperatures of 180°F+
in temperatures as low as 10°F.

What is the tent made of? Does it release any chemicals?

Our tents are made of Oxford 210D Nylon that is rated to 300°F, meaning it
will not melt or leach chemicals at 200°F (the approximate highest temperature
our saunas go). The tent windows are made of a high-temperature performance
TPU. We put our saunas through testing using the highest quality, USA NIST
calibrated equipment on the market from Forensics Detectors. Our test results
show that when SweatTent is heated to 200°F there are zero concentrations of
CO or VOCs present in the air.

What is the recommended flooring?

Your SweatTent can be placed on concrete, tile, dirt, grass, turf, wood
(unvarnished), or ice (at least 1 ft thick). Pro tip: for an elevated and
functional aesthetic, visit your local Home Depot, Lowe's or Ikea to purchase
interlocking wood tile flooring.

How long does it take to heat up?

It takes 20-30 minutes to reach temperatures of 176°F-200F. How much firewood
you use, what type of firewood you use, and time of year will impact the
heating time. 3-4 pieces of split hardwood firewood is typically sufficient to
get Sweat Tent heated to therapeutic temperatures of 176°F+.

What are the assembled dimensions?

6ft (L) x 6ft (W) x 7ft (H). The chimney extends 2ft above the roof.

Does it smell? How do you clean it?

It does not smell, and there is not much cleaning required. Moisture runs down
the sides of the tent walls and drains onto the ground. Any residual moisture
is evaporated due to the high heat inside the tent. We recommend emptying the
ash tray and removing excess soot from the chimney after every 3-4 uses.

What prevents it from blowing over in windy conditions?

Sweat Tent has a built-in skirt running along both the interior and exterior
of the base. We recommend weighing down the skirt with heavy weights such as
cinder blocks, bricks, or sandbags. It also comes with ground stakes and ropes
to tie it down and secure it further in windier conditions.

Can you leave it up outside permanently?

Yes, you can leave it up outside permanently, with a few exceptions. SweatTent
is made from a durable, weather-resistant fabric and includes a weatherproof
roof cover. Keep the roof cover on at all times. Pack it up and store it
indoors during times of extreme weather like heavy snow/wind storms.

What's included in the order?

Each order includes the tent, stove, rocks, rocks holder, thermometer, roof
cover, fire poker & gloves. The bench, water bucket+ladle, and other
accessories are available as add ons.

What size wood can fit in the stove?

The max length of firewood you can feed into the stove is 16 inches. We
recommend using split hardwood cut to 12 inches long. The opening of the stove
is 8.5 inches wide x 5 inches tall.

Does it produce much smoke?

Once heated, Sweat Tent produces very little smoke. This is thanks in part to
our innovative stove design featuring a built-in spark arrestor. We also
recommend using dry hardwood firewood and avoiding softwood firewood &
synthetic fire logs.

## Features

3 minute setup and takedown

Just 3 minutes from unzip to fire lit with our special "QuickPop" tent design
and "EasyStack" chimney.

Heats up to 200°F in 30 minutes

Our powerful stove combined with our 3-ply insulated tent produce the highest
heat output possible (200°F) in the shortest amount of time (30 minutes)

Fits up to 3 people

Spacious interior fits 3 people comfortably.

Ultra efficient

Pay an average of $2 per sauna session (3 wood logs)

Retains heat in any climate

Retains heat very well, even in colder climates. Tested in temperatures as low
as 10°F.

Built to the highest safety standards

Our integrated spark arrestor, fireproof roof cover, & steel-plated chimney
vent protect your sauna and your surroundings from damage.

Made with non-toxic materials

Made from heat-resistant Oxford 210D Nylon & TPU, and tested in temperatures
exceeding 200°F, you can rest assured that there is no risk of chemical off-
gassing.

## Peace of mind

Every SweatTent comes with a 1 year manufacturer warranty out of box.

  
We also have a 100% Satisfaction Guarantee. If you're not 100% satisfied with
your SweatTent, you have 60 days to return it for a full refund.
